feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculator accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working day count and supports both calendar day and working day leave policies. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system automatically generates a pay deduction reflected on the payroll table. This ensures accurate salary reductions based on the employee's leave policy and the specific month's working days.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages to determine salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts based on different calculation bases and salary components.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations, including selection of salary components and calculation methods.
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and payroll settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator by navigating to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection
Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation to access salary proration configuration

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee; the employee's salary information (basic and allowance components) must be configured in the system.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to accurately exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator.
Access to Leave Settings and Leave Policies configuration as a Super Admin
Super admin role and access to payroll settings; payroll system must be configured

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary amount (basic plus allowance), number of working days in the month, number of public holidays in the month, and the applicable leave policy type (calendar days or working days).

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, reflected on the payroll table; calculated daily pay rate used to determine the total deduction amount.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and determines which salary components and calculation methods apply to leave encashment.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation settings that apply daily deductions to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) payroll amounts

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate the total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days to arrive at actual working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the desired calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select applicable salary components for leave encashment (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types eligible for encashment in end-of-service calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and resave the proration settings to apply changes.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by Number of Actual Working Days. The leave policy determines whether calculation is based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days count to determine actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation base options are calendar days (total days in the month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (flexible configuration per company policy). Most UAE and KSA companies use 30 custom days to comply with labor law requirements.

Salary component selection is limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method must be one of three options: calendar days, working days, or custom days. Leave encashment configuration affects end-of-service calculations.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; calculation method and day type must be selected during policy configuration

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22-day working policy, the calculation uses 20 days instead of 22 days.

Calendar days vary by month (e.g., January has 31 days, February has 28 days), which affects daily wage calculations. Different calculation bases produce different daily wage rates and impact final salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts.
Super admins can view which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new leave encashment configuration, allowing them to understand the impact of their changes.

Multiple calculation method options are available (Basic Only and Basic + Allowances) and multiple day calculation types (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days), requiring careful selection based on organizational policy
When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new salary proration settings

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: Interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions; integrates with leave management system to receive approved unpaid leave requests and with employee record systems to access salary information.

The Daily Wage Calculator directly impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It depends on the company's public holiday calendar configuration and integrates with payroll processing systems.
The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with payroll settings, end-of-service calculations, and leave management systems to customize leave encashment policies that affect final settlement calculations.
Interacts with the payroll system to apply daily unpaid leave deductions to monthly employee pay; similar to leave encashment functionality
Interacts with Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; impacts first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, derived from dividing total salary by actual working days. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Calendar days leave policy: Leave policy based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days per month). Working days leave policy: Leave policy based on working days (e.g., 22 working days per month).

Calendar days: the total number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set up on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: flexible calculation base set by payroll managers according to company policies, commonly set to 30 days in UAE and KSA to align with labor law.

Leave encashment: The process of converting accrued but unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: The final settlement calculation when an employee leaves the organization. Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee that is not compensated and results in daily deductions from monthly pay. Daily rate calculation: The method used to compute deductions on a per-day basis. Leave encashment: Similar feature for calculating leave value in monetary terms.

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining prorated salary (custom days, calendar days, working days).
